comment: Very unorganized, and doesn't really know how to teach. He is a good person though and cares about his students. He's very scattered but i managed an A and barely read. So he's better than most.

Pros: Interesting lectures  Cons: Highly disorganized, class schedule changes on daily basis. Material is not hard but you must keep track of assignment due dates as they change constantly. It is a hassle.

I have never been more displeased with a professor. His lectures are repetitive and convoluted, and he spent a good fourth of class time lecturing about class participation and "being nice to him". Every. Single. Day. It's an easy A if you go to class, but be prepared to sit through an extremely painful lecture.

Very knowledgeable about the subject and cares very much about teaching and his students. A little unclear about what will be on the quizzes but be safe and study everything on the power pointsread the book. 3 quizzes and a final and he drops the lowest quiz grade. Easy A if you actually try, quizzes are easy.

Although he is sometimes a nice person, he is a horrible professor! Barely understood, not helpful when you come to him one on one, and doesn't respond to emails. 3 test, but doesn't help prepare you for them. Teaches 3 classes this semester and all 3 classes have reported him to the chair of sociology. Avoid at all cost!!!!!

Please, do not take him. He was a very kind person, but his lack of organization and clarification were truly frustrating. The schedule was a joke, lectures were repetitive, tests were confusing and often contained many incorrect answers, he rarely stuck to his word, miscalculated grades often, and essentially did not know how to teach a class.
